message: Failed to fetch data from Google Apps Script API
context: This error typically occurs when the Google Apps Script URL is incorrect or the script is not deployed properly.
solutions: Check the Google Apps Script URL in config.js
Verify that the script is deployed with 'Anyone' access
Test the API endpoint directly in browser

message: Modal dialog not displaying correctly on mobile devices
context: This error occurs when the modal dialog CSS is not responsive on smaller screens.
solutions: Add responsive CSS for mobile devices
Use viewport units instead of fixed pixels
Test on multiple device sizes

context: This error occurred when the service worker file was not in the root directory.
solutions: Ensure service-worker.js is in the root directory
Check the path in the registration code
Verify service worker scope
resolution: Moved service-worker.js to root directory and updated registration path

context: This error happens when trying to access data before it's loaded from the API.
solutions: Add proper null checks before accessing data
Implement loading states in UI
Use optional chaining (?.) operator

message: Blocked by CORS policy: No 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' header
context: This error occurred when trying to make direct API calls to Google Sheets without using Google Apps Script as a proxy.
solutions: Use Google Apps Script as a proxy for API calls
Set proper CORS headers in the backend
Ensure the API endpoint allows requests from the app domain
resolution: Implemented Google Apps Script as proxy for all API calls

context: This error happened when trying to store too much data in localStorage without cleaning it up.
solutions: Implement data cleanup mechanism
Use IndexedDB for larger data storage
Compress data before storing
Set expiration for stored data
resolution: Implemented automatic cleanup of old data and compression for large objects

context: This error occurred when the LINE LIFF ID was incorrect or not properly configured.
solutions: Verify the LINE LIFF ID in config.js
Check LINE Developer Console for correct configuration
Ensure the LIFF app is in 'Published' status
resolution: Updated LINE LIFF ID and verified configuration in LINE Developer Console
